author: Staff Reporter
text:
The 16-year-old boy who murdered an 18-year-old college girl on February 12 at her residence here surrendered before the Judicial Magistrate I K. Kavitha in Dindigul court on Monday.

C. Abirami of Bhodupatti Colony in the town was pursing her course at a private teacher training college in Budhansandai. The Plus One student of Old Ayakudi in Palani in Dindigul district recently approached the girl’s parents and sought for a marriage proposal. But, her parents turned down the proposal and asked him to concentrate on studies.

Irked by this, the boy on February 12 entered her house and silts her throat with knife and fled the house. Her parents and relatives immediately took her to District Government Headquarters Hospital where doctors declared her dead. Based on a complaint, the Namakkal police registered a case and are on the look out for the boy.

On Monday, the boy surrendered before the magistrate who asked the police to lodge him at Borstal in Paramathi Velur.

The police said that his custody would be sought soon for interrogation.
title: Murder accused minor boy surrenders in Dindigul court
